</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;3e70cfb5.1502">   <title>New Film on Women, Feminism & Islam </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;3e70cfb5.1502</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I am attaching some information about a new film from Women Make Movies that might be of interest to you:<br><br>FEMINISM INSHALLAH: A History of Arab Feminism http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c890.shtml&lt;http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c890.shtmll&gt;<br>The struggle for Muslim women's emancipation is often portrayed stereotypically as a showdown between Western and Islamic values, but Arab feminism has existed for more than a century. This groundbreaking documentary recounts Arab feminism's largely unknown story, from its taboo-shattering birth in Egypt by feminist pioneers up through viral Internet campaigns by today's tech-savvy young activists during the Arab Spring. FEMINISM INSHALLAH is an indispensable resource for Women's Studies, Global [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T22:39:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;3e70cfb5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;8162ba48.1502">   <title>Join Us: 2015 Interdisciplinary Sex/Gender conference at UCLA (October 23-24, 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;8162ba48.1502</link>   <description> A Critical Moment: Sex/Gender Research at the Intersection of Culture,<br>Brain, &amp; Behavior<br>WHEN: October 23-24, 2015 - Save the Date<br>WHERE: UCLA, Los Angeles, California<br><br>WEBSITES<br>http://www.thefpr.org/conference2015/<br>http://www.thefprconference2015.org &lt;http://www.thefprconference2015.org/&gt;<br><br>Be there when many of the world\ufffd\ufffds leading scholars from the Humanities and<br>Sciences discuss and debate issues at the intersection of sex/gender,<br>culture, brain, and behavior.<br>Great minds. Thrilling discussions. New connections. It\ufffd\ufffds all happening this<br>October 23-24, 2015 at UCLA. Join Us. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T11:28:51-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;8162ba48.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;75fb122.1502">   <title>Vocabularies of Active Female Desire: A FemGenSex Symposium at Middlesex University 30 March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;75fb122.1502</link>   <description> &gt; The School of Media and Performing Arts and The School of Law invite you to a FemGenSex Network event:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Vocabularies of Active Female Desire: A FemGenSex Symposium<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Monday, 30 March 2015 from 13:00 to 17:30<br>&gt;<br>&gt; To book a free ticket please register on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/vocabularies-of-active-female-desire-a-femgensex-symposium-tickets-15356200810<br>&gt;<br>> Despite years of heated debate, reaching back at least as far as the feminist sex wars of the 1970s and 1980s, issues surrounding the depiction of active female desire remain high on the cultural agenda. Whether it be new UK regulations taking aim at the depiction [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T08:06:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Feona Attwood</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;75fb122.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;dfe96fe9.1502">   <title>Unbought and Unbossed - Transgressive Black Women, Sexuality, and Representation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;dfe96fe9.1502</link>   <description> Dear IASSC Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following title will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Unbought and Unbossed]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/unbought-and-unbossed&gt;Unbought and Unbossed&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/unbought-and-unbossed&gt;<br><br>Transgressive Black Women, Sexuality, and Representation<br>Trimiko Melancon<br>&quot;Trimiko Melancon offers beautiful and complex readings of novels by Toni Morrison, Ann Allen Shockley, Alice Walker, Gayl Jones, and Gloria Naylor while effortlessly synthesizing a generation of scholarship on black sexuality. Unbought and Unbossed is a refreshingly innovative new work destined to become a classic.&quot; -Robert F. Reid-Pharr, author of Once You Go Black: Choice, Desire, and the Black American Intellectual<br>"Unbought and Unbossed is an interesting exploration of black female sexual [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T12:14:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;dfe96fe9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95cc756b.1501">   <title>Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos - Two Aspects of Human Nature </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95cc756b.1501</link>   <description> Dear IASSC subscribers,<br><br>We hope you find this title of interest.<br><br>[Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/incest-avoidance-and-the-incest-taboos&gt;Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/incest-avoidance-and-the-incest-taboos&gt;<br><br>Two Aspects of Human Nature<br>Arthur Wolf<br>&quot;In this highly readable account of incest avoidance and taboos, Arthur Wolf explores fundamental questions about what it is to be human. In particular, he examines the articulation between our biological and our social/cultural natures, arriving at some brilliant insights along the way. Every student of anthropology should read this book.&quot;-Charles Stafford, London School of Economics<br>"Arthur Wolf has done it again. Wolf's evolutionary explanation of incest avoidance and the incest [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T17:24:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95cc756b.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ef776e20.1501">   <title>FPR-UCLA Interdisciplinary Conference on Sex/Gender (October 23-24, 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ef776e20.1501</link>   <description> 6th FPR-UCLA Interdisciplinary Conference<br>A Critical Moment: Sex/Gender Research at the Intersection of Culture,<br>Brain, &amp; Behavior<br>October 23-24, 2015<br>UCLA, Los Angeles, California<br><br>WEBSITES:<br>http://www.thefpr.org/conference2015/<br>http://www.thefprconference2015.org &lt;http://www.thefprconference2015.org/&gt;<br><br>This conference occurs at a critical juncture in sex/gender research in<br>neuroscience, anthropology, psychology, and related disciplines. New<br>theories are utilizing a conception of the brain as dynamic, plastic, and<br>adaptable, and of sex/gender brain and behavioral differences as subject to<br>the influence of a broad range of biological, cultural, and social or<br>environmental factors. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T11:24:59-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ef776e20.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;58b6fe3b.1412">   <title>Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;58b6fe3b.1412</link>   <description> News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T11:16:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Higham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;58b6fe3b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2429216b.1412">   <title>Gender and Education: Critical Issues, Policy and Practice 28-30 May 2015, Bloomington, IN, United States </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2429216b.1412</link>   <description> Apologies for any cross-posting. Please circulate widely.<br><br>International Conference on<br>Gender and Education<br>Critical Issues, Policy and Practice<br>28-30 May 2015, Bloomington, IN, United States<br><br>Organising Institutions:<br>Gender Studies Platform, London Centre for Social Studies (LCSS)<br>School of Education, Indiana University-Bloomington<br>Centre for Gender in Global Context (GENCEN), Michigan State University<br>Department of Law, Gediz University<br><br>Call for Proposals<br>The abstract submission deadline has now been extended till Monday, 22nd<br>December 2014<br>The International Conference on Gender and Education aims to engage researchers,<br>academics and policy makers in discussions and debates concerning the interplay<br>between gender related issues and educational [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T16:30:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gender and Education</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2429216b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d78e372.1412">   <title>Sexuall Cultures Conference; deadline extended till Jan 9 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d78e372.1412</link>   <description> Sexual Cultures 2<br>April 8-10 2015 University of Sunderland London Campus, South Quay, London, UK<br><br>This conference, co-hosted by the Centre for Research in Media and Cultural Studies, University of Sunderland, and the Onscenity Research Network will take place on April 8-10 2015 at the University of Sunderland London Campus, London, UK [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T06:15:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Feona Attwood</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d78e372.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;f3bda0d4.1411">   <title>Watch the LGBTI Human Rights in the Commonwealth conference film, from Mandela Day </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;f3bda0d4.1411</link>   <description> Watch the LGBTI Human Rights in the Commonwealth conference film, from Mandela Day<br>Videos of the LGBTI Human Rights in the Commonwealth international conference are now available to view online as a resource for education and activism. The conference was held at University of Glasgow on Mandela Day, 18 July 2014. Six videos produced by University of Glasgow are available on the Glasgow Human Rights Network website:<br>http://www.gla.ac.uk/research/az/glasgowhumanrightsnetwork/lgbtihrc/conferencevideos/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-30T16:41:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Matthew Waites</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;f3bda0d4.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;828775c5.1410">   <title>International Conference Beliefs and Behaviours in Education and Culture, Timisoara Romania </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;828775c5.1410</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The Teacher Training Department, West University of Timi\ufffd\ufffdoara (Romania), is<br>pleased to announce the International Conference *Beliefs and Behaviours in<br>Education and Culture*, which<br>will be held in June 25 - 27, 2015.<br><br>The aim of the conference, proposing interdisciplinary perspectives, is to<br>build comprehensive and holistic explanations of beliefs from different<br>sciences that have a great impact upon education and culture. The<br>conference addresses themes related to issues and processes of education at<br>any level, from kindergarten to lifelong learning, from formal to informal<br>education. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-31T15:35:54+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>carmen tiru</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;828775c5.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;cd2cfcaf.1410">   <title>sexual cultures conference deadline approaching </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;cd2cfcaf.1410</link>   <description> CONFERENCE CALL FOR ABSTRACTS<br><br>April 8-10 2015 University of Sunderland London Campus, South Quay, London, UK<br><br>This conference, co-hosted by the Centre for Research in Media and Cultural Studies&lt;http://www.crmcs.sunderland.ac.uk/&gt;, University of Sunderland, and the Onscenity Research Network will take place on April 8-10 2015 at the University of Sunderland London Campus, London, UK [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T07:42:06+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Feona Attwood</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;cd2cfcaf.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ec195e72.1410">   <title>The Tolerance Trap: How God, Genes, and Good Intentions are Sabotaging Gay Equality </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ec195e72.1410</link>   <description> [Description: http://nyuconnexus.seisan.com/uploads/products/9780814770573/9780814770573_Full.jpg]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap&gt;The Tolerance Trap&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap&gt;<br><br>How God, Genes, and Good Intentions are Sabotaging Gay Equality<br>Suzanna Danuta Walters<br>&quot;It's refreshing that an American academic, Suzanna Danuta Walters, has come forward with the heretical tract called The Tolerance Trap [...] she's at her most pertinent when questioning those twin pillars of current American gay orthodoxy, gay genes and gay marriage, which are mutually reinforcing.&quot;-The Independent<br>"Whether you are lesbian, gay or straight, Suzanna Walters's new book should make you wonder how the once kick-ass gay rights movement became so meek and humble. [...] The Tolerance Trap serves as a cautionary tale in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-23T10:40:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ec195e72.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;5cb6c9b3.1410">   <title>New Release! SIX DAYS: Three Activists, Three Wars, One Dream </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;5cb6c9b3.1410</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of independent films by and about women. I thought the members of this listserv would be interested in our newest release: SIX DAYS: Three Activists, Three Wars, One Dream&lt;http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c878.shtml&gt;, a captivating educational resource that the London Film Festival calls &quot;(A) political tool that can be used for advocacy...to improve the situation for women's rights defenders.&quot; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-21T21:19:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;5cb6c9b3.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2954941c.1410">   <title>Light Fly, Fly High - A Film by Susann \ufffd\ufffdstigaard and Beathe Hofseth</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2954941c.1410</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of independent films by and about women. I thought the members of this listserv would be interested in our newest release: LIGHT FLY, FLY HIGH&lt;http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c869.shtml&gt;, an award winning captivating educational resource that One World Media calls &quot;Revelatory, unpredictable, and highly engaging...a microcosm for women's issues that badly need highlighting.&quot; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T15:36:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;2954941c.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;afc19ad6.1410">   <title><No subject> </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;afc19ad6.1410</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of independent films by and about women. I thought the members of this listserv would be interested in our newest release: LIGHT FLY, FLY HIGH&lt;http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c869.shtml&gt;, an award winning captivating educational resource that One World Media calls &quot;Revelatory, unpredictable, and highly engaging...a microcosm for women's issues that badly need highlighting.&quot; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T15:21:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;afc19ad6.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d6c2930.1410">   <title>Making Sense of Intersex: Changing Ethical Perspectives in Biomedicine </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d6c2930.1410</link>   <description> [9780253012289_FChigh]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/making-sense-of-intersex&gt;Making Sense of Intersex&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/making-sense-of-intersex&gt;<br>Changing Ethical Perspectives in Biomedicine&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/making-sense-of-intersex&gt;<br>By Ellen K. Feder<br>&quot;Rich with cross-discipline potential, Feder's engaging argument should provide a new approach for doctors and parents caring for children with atypical sex anatomy.&quot; -Publishers Weekly (Starred Review)<br>&quot;Feder's book is a welcome injection of new ideas into feminist scholarship on intersex, post-Consensus Statement era.&quot; -Women's Review of Books<br>Putting the ethical tools of philosophy to work, Ellen K. Feder seeks to clarify how we should understand "the problem" of intersex. Adults often report that medical interventions they underwent as children to "correct" atypical sex anatomies caused them [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T10:23:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9d6c2930.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ea7bfe24.1410">   <title>FEMINIST STORIES FROM WOMEN\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdS LIBERATION | Now Available from WMM!</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ea7bfe24.1410</link>   <description> NEW FROM WMM: FEMINIST STORIES FROM WOMEN'S LIBERATION<br><br>&quot;...a documentary I wish were mandatory viewing in schools \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd&quot;<br>Ellen Snortland<br>Pasadena Weekly<br><br>Hi all,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of films by and about women. I thought the members of this listserv would be interested in our newest release: FEMINIST STORIES FROM WOMEN'S LIBERATION&lt;http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c876.shtml&gt;, an award winning captivating educational resource. To celebrate this release, WMM is offering a special promotion of 50% off a related collection when you buy FEMINIST STORIES at list price.* [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T15:33:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ea7bfe24.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;954c90d3.1410">   <title>New titles in Sexuality and Culture Studies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;954c90d3.1410</link>   <description> *apologies for cross posting<br>[cid:image009.jpg@01CFE488.F9344030]Given to the Goddess<br><br>South Indian Devadasis and the Sexuality of Religion<br>Lucinda Ramberg&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/lucinda-ramberg&gt;<br><br>&quot;A compassionate and rigorous account of the much reviled and celebrated figure of the devadasi, Lucinda Ramberg's book analyzes the central role women's sexuality continues to play in religious and secular political orders. Rather than diagnose this as a moral problem, the author forces us to rethink how the biopolitical state has transformed both religion and sexuality in modern India.&quot;-Saba Mahmood, author of Politics of Piety: The Islamic Revival and the Feminist Subject<br>Who and what are marriage and sex for? Whose [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T11:51:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Boyle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;954c90d3.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ff485e3.1410">   <title>A View from the Bottom: Asian American Masculinity and Sexual Representation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ff485e3.1410</link>   <description> *Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[cid:image002.jpg@01CFE21C.41721170]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/a-view-from-the-bottom&gt;A View from the Bottom<br><br>Asian American Masculinity and Sexual Representation<br>Nguyen Tan Hoang<br><br>&quot;Artist-scholar Nguyen Tan Hoang's dexterous unpacking of a Hollywood classic, the oeuvre of a gay Asian American porn star, an international art house film, videos by gay Asian artists and the self-representation of online sex sites challenged me to radically rethink the terms and stakes for reconsidering the representation of Asian American masculinity. A profoundly insightful and provocative book.&quot;-Richard Fung [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T09:48:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Boyle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;ff485e3.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;14d2a8c5.1409">   <title>The Tolerance Trap </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;14d2a8c5.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[Description: Description: Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\F01 images\\NYU IMAGES\\9780814770573.jpg]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap&gt;The Tolerance Trap&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap&gt;<br><br>How God, Genes, and Good Intentions are Sabotaging Gay Equality<br>Suzanna Danuta Walters<br><br>"Whether you are lesbian, gay or straight, Suzanna Walters's new book should make you wonder how the once kick-ass gay rights movement became so meek and humble. [...] The Tolerance Trap serves as a cautionary tale in a climate in which the majority of spokespeople for LGBT rights are mired in appeasement and assimilation, meekly asking to be accepted rather than demanding equality and respect. There has been a shift from angry radicalism to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-01T14:40:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Boyle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;14d2a8c5.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9e26bfe7.1408">   <title>FINAL CALL:[CFP] Queer Kinship and Relationships,Conference 2015/abstracts till sept.15th </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9e26bfe7.1408</link>   <description> ----------------------Apologies for crossposting \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Please distribute<br>widely----------------------<br><br>_*Queer Kinship and Relationships*__* International Conference, 08-11 June 2015*_<br>Zalesie, Masuria, Poland<br><br>[*_CALL FOR PAPERS]_*<br>Studies of non-heterosexual kinship in modern societies are well established in the Anglophone countries, dating back to such \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdclassical\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd text as Eshter Newton\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMother Camp\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (1972) and<br>especially Kath Weston\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFamilies We Choose\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (1991). The once original body of work has now become \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcanonical\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and mandatory point of reference for subsequent researchers.<br>Canonization, however, presents us with the obvious perils of hegemonization and domination of theories that perhaps do not necessarily fit into the diverse (i.e. non-Western) social [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-30T19:55:13+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Agata Stasi\ufffd\ufffdska</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;9e26bfe7.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;59bfb977.1408">   <title>Research Associate post at the University of Glasgow </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;59bfb977.1408</link>   <description> *** Thanks for distributing / Apologies for cross-posting ***<br><br>The School of Social and Political Sciences at the University of Glasgow welcomes applications for a full-time Research Associate post (start date Jan 2015). The successful candidate will work on the ESRC-funded 2-year project \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIntimate migrations: exploring the experiences of LGB (lesbian, gay, bisexual) migrants from Eastern Europe and the Former Soviet Union in Scotland\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. We are looking for a Research Associate with a PhD in sociology or related discipline. Applicants should have extensive experience of conducting qualitative research, of managing different data sets, and of analysing complex data, as well [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-25T11:13:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Francesca Stella</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;59bfb977.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95f0e74e.1408">   <title>Eleven Films Review in Films for the Feminist Classroom! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95f0e74e.1408</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Hi All,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of films by and about women.<br>We are happy to announce that eleven Women Make Movies films are reviewed in the latest issue of Feminist Films for the Classroom&lt;http://ffc.twu.edu/&gt;!<br><br>This amazing collection of WMM films reviewed covers a various array of issues from the women's movement in Islamic culture, to a transnational perspective on sex trafficking, to media representation of young girls and women, to music and social change. Each review outlines how the films can be used as tools to teach the subject in the feminist [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-21T19:22:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Women Make Movies Educate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;95f0e74e.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;3e11c8bc.1408">   <title><No subject> </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=IASSC;3e11c8bc.1408</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Hi All,<br><br>I'm writing from Women Make Movies, the leading nonprofit distributor of films by and about women.<br><br>We are happy to announce that eleven Women Make Movies films are reviewed in the latest issue of Feminist Films for the Classroom&lt;http://ffc.twu.edu/&gt;!<br><br>This amazing collection of WMM films reviewed covers a various array of issues from the women's movement in Islamic culture, to a transnational perspective on sex trafficking, to media representation of young girls and women, to music and social change.
